conclusion: Plan to analyze the p-V diagram and use the ideal gas law to find the final temperature.
The p-V diagram shows points A, B, and C with pressure decreasing and volume increasing from A to C.
The process from A to B is isobaric, so temperature increases as volume increases.
From B to C, the process is isochoric, so temperature remains constant.
Given temperature at A is 27°C, temperature at C is also 27°C since it remains constant from B to C.
The temperature of the gas in state C is the same as in state A.
